block.p: Sutton Thurman Brown and Thibault Christian Stracke were married yesterday by the Rev. Charles D. Robison at the Central Presbyterian Church in New York.

Mrs. Stracke, 28, is the associate director of development in charge of fund-raising for the Cunningham Dance Foundation in New York. She graduated from Converse College in Spartanburg, S.C. Her parents, Reba and John T. Brown, live in Augusta, Ga., where her father is an architect in private practice and her mother is a social worker for the Veterans Administration.
Sutton Thurman Brown and Thibault Christian Stracke were married yesterday by the Rev. Charles D. Robison at the Central Presbyterian Church in New York.

Mrs. Stracke, 28, is the associate director of development in charge of fund-raising for the Cunningham Dance Foundation in New York. She graduated from Converse College in Spartanburg, S.C. Her parents, Reba and John T. Brown, live in Augusta, Ga., where her father is an architect in private practice and her mother is a social worker for the Veterans Administration.

Mr. Stracke, 28, is known as Christian. He is a strategist in Latin American currency at the New York office of Deutsche Bank. He graduated from the University of Chicago and was a Peace Corps volunteer from 1992 to 1994, working in Oumm El Khezz, Mauritania, on the edge of the Sahara Desert, where he taught tree planting and anti-erosion techniques. His parents, Claire Stracke and Dr. Richard Stracke, also live in Augusta. The bridegroom's mother teaches Spanish at the Davidson Fine Arts High School in Augusta, where he and the bride met as students. His father is an English professor at Augusta State University.
